text.section: Any person who violates any of the provisions of KRS 118.136 shall be guilty of a Class A misdemeanor.
If the Secretary of State violates any of the provisions of subsection (4) of KRS 118.215, he shall be guilty of a Class D felony.
Any person who violates subsection (5) of KRS 118.176 shall be guilty of a Class A misdemeanor.
If any county clerk violates any of the provisions of subsection (5) of KRS 118.305, he shall be guilty of a Class D felony.

law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 48, sec. 59, effective July 13, 1990; and ch. 366, sec. 9, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 188, sec. 100, effective July 15, 1980. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 384, sec. 562, effective June 17, 1978. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 130, sec. 156, effective June 21, 1974.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/13/90). This section was amended by two 1990 Acts which do not appear to be in conflict and have been compiled together.
